title: Tusker ‘Sumedha’ who lost one tusk in accident found in the wild
byline: The tusker who lost one of its tusks in a recent accident involving a lorry on the Habarana – Maradankadawala road was found by the wildlife authorities near a tank in the village called ‘Labunorua’ in the Tirappane division of the Anuradhapura District.

title: No discrimination in entering oral questions in order paper: Speaker
byline: Opposition members have not be subjected to any discrimination when entering oral questions in the order papers, Speaker Jagath Wickramaratne told Parliament today.

title: Sri Lanka climbs out of world’s top polluted cities, but still falls short of WHO standards
byline: After months and a series of media reports highlighting that Sri Lanka’s air quality had been deteriorating, the country was not featured in 2024’s top 50 list of world’s most air-polluted cities and narrowly sitting on 51, based on Swiss air quality monitoring firm, IQAir.

title: Shiromala launches counter attack
byline: Sri Lankan Olympic boxing official fights back against ‘malicious campaign’ on IBA suspension threat

title: Sri Lanka will gain ASEAN nembership soon: Minister
byline: Sri Lanka will soon gain membership of the Association of South East Asian Nations (ASEAN), Minister of Foreign Affairs Vijitha Hearth told Parliament today.

title: As the beauty industry soars, Sri Lanka fails in regulating cosmetics
byline: With the worldwide beauty industry milking in billions with the promise of making individuals more beautiful, fairer and younger, Sri Lanka has to date failed to regulate the use of cosmetics, leading to severe health concerns as unauthorised creams and substances continue to be sold in the market.

title: Sri Lanka’s financial phishing cases spike in 2024: Kaspersky
byline: Sri Lanka is increasingly vulnerable to cyberattacks targeting businesses’ financial transactions, with 9,218 incidents of financial phishing detected in 2024 alone, according to the latest Kaspersky Security Bulletin.

title: Two brothers hacked to death in Grandpass
byline: Two brothers, aged 23 and 24, were brutally hacked to death during a clash between two groups in Kelanitissagama, Grandpass, early this morning (15).

title: Good demand at tea auction this week despite dip in offering
byline: The auction offerings declined further this week and totalled 5.0 million kilogrammes (M/Kgs) but was met with good general demand.

title: March tourist arrivals cross 100,000 mark in two weeks
byline: The tourist arrivals to Sri Lanka have surpassed 97,000 within the first 13 days of March, the latest provisional data from the Sri Lanka Tourism Development Authority showed.

title: Week ends with foreign buying
byline: The ASPI edged down as a result of price losses in counters such as Hatton National Bank, National Development Bank and Bukit Darah with the turnover crossing Rs. 1.0 Bn. Meanwhile, the S&P SL20 edged up.

title: CID questions Tennakoon’s family amid search
byline: Officers from the Criminal Investigation Department (CID) have recorded statements from the wife and son of Inspector General of Police (IGP) Deshabandu Tennakoon, who is currently evading court proceedings.

title: Sri Lanka seeks ASEAN sectoral partnership, not membership: Minister
byline: Sri Lanka has only sought ASEAN Sectoral Dialogue Partnership and not ASEAN membership, Foreign Affairs Minister Vijitha Hearth said.

title: Ranil used Rs. 16 mn public funds for private visit to UK: Bimal alleges
byline: Leader of the House Minister Bimal Rathnayake revealed today that former President Ranil Wickremesinghe had used public funds of Sterling Pounds 40,000 (Over Rs. 16 million) for a private visit with his wife to the United Kingdom in 2023.

title: NPP women MPs want clear, definite standards for police, judges, media to handle crimes against women
byline: In the wake of the sexual assault on a lady doctor at the Anuradhapura Hospital, the NPP women Parliamentarians said that clear and definite standards should be put in place for the police, the judges and the media to handle cases of crimes against women.
